subject: Climate & Environment
title: Cooking with Solid Fuels
description: A 60-second lesson on Cooking with Solid Fuels.

hook.text: About 2.4 billion people cook over open fires fueled by wood, dung, or charcoal.

buildup.text: Smoke fills kitchens with PM2.5 levels 20 times higher than a polluted city street.

discovery.text: Household air pollution kills about 3.2 million people each year â€” mostly women and children.

twist.text: Clean cookstoves exist and cost as little as $25. Distribution is the real barrier.

climax.text: Switching to LPG or electric stoves slashes indoor pollution by over 90% immediately.

punchline.text: The deadliest air pollution isn't outside. It's in the kitchen.

quiz.question: How many people still cook over open fires with solid fuels?
